original_title: Sri Lanka president makes key appointments to election and human rights commissions
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka President Ranil Wickremesinghe has appointed key appointments to the island nation’s national election commission and human rights commission.
Lalith Dehideniya, a former Supreme Court judge, was appointed as Chairman of the Human Rights Commission of Sri Lanka (HRCSL) on Friday June 29.

Following Dehideniya’s appointment, Nimalasena Gardier Pundihewa, Thaiyamuttu Thanaraj, Fathima Farzana Hanifa and Gehan Dinuk Gunatillake were also appointed as members of the commission, the PMD said.
Meanwhile, R M A L Rathnayake, a former Additional Commissioner General of Elections, has been appointed as Chairman of the Election Commission.
Pathmasiri Chandrawansha Perera and Ameer Mohommed Faiz have also been appointed as members of the commission.
President @RW_UNP appoints members to both the Election Commission (EC) and the Human Rights Commission of #SriLanka (HRCSL). @HRCSriLanka #LKA #PMD pic.twitter.com/4LSCWrHWNn
